marketNews.title: Foreign Inflow, Big Banks Lead IHSG Rebound
marketNews.content: The IHSG strengthened +0.5% to the level of 7,109.20 today, Friday (31/1), led by gains in BBCA (+3.3%) and BBRI (+2.4%) along with the entry of foreign inflow. Net foreign inflow recorded 297 billion rupiah today. Year-to-date, the IHSG still recorded a net foreign outflow of 3.7 trillion rupiah. The foreign inflow today consisted of 268 billion rupiah in the regular market and 29 billion rupiah in the cash and negotiated markets. The largest net foreign inflow in the regular market today was contributed by $BBRI (271 billion rupiah), $BBCA (162 billion rupiah), and $BBNI (44 billion rupiah). Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) was the only big bank that posted a net foreign outflow, amounting to 112 billion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess that the foreign inflow into big banks today is an indication that the Indonesian market is starting to become attractive for foreign investors following the decline in US bond yields. If there is no escalation in trade tariff policies from the US government - which could have implications for US inflation and interest rate prospects - we assess that there is still room for further strengthening in big bank stocks given their attractive valuations. Here are the 1-Year Forward P/B valuations for big banks as of Friday (31/1): BBRI: 1.89x (~1SD below the 10-year historical average), BMRI: 1.79x (~0.5SD above the 10-year historical average), BBNI: 1.02x (~0.5SD below the 10-year historical average), BBCA: 3.99x (~0.5SD above the 10-year historical average).

marketNews.title: Investment Realization and LPG Policy Update
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Investment and Downstreaming recorded that investment realization in Q4 2024 reached 452.8 trillion rupiah (+4.9% QoQ, +23.8% YoY), with 54.3% of it coming from foreign direct investment. This result brought investment realization in Indonesia throughout 2024 to 1,714.2 trillion rupiah (+20.8% YoY), exceeding (103.9%) the government target of 1,650 trillion rupiah, with labor absorption reaching ~2.5 million people. Foreign direct investment contributed 52.5% of the total investment realization throughout 2024. Geographically, outside of Java contributed 52.2% of the total investment realization throughout 2024. Kontan reported that the government is prohibiting the sale of 3 kg liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) through retailers starting February 1, 2025. Deputy Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) Yuliot Tanjung said that retailers who wish to continue selling subsidized LPG must be registered as official bases or sub-distributors of Pertamina. Yuliot stated that this policy aims to ensure that the distribution of subsidized LPG is more on target. Additionally, a shorter distribution chain is expected to make the price of 3 kg LPG comply with government regulations.

marketNews.title: US Tariff Threats and Global Market Impact
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump, on Thursday (30/1), warned BRICS member countries not to replace the US dollar as a reserve currency if they do not want to be subject to a 100% import tariff. Indonesia itself has been a permanent member of BRICS since early 2025. US President Donald Trump stated on Thursday (30/1) that he would implement a 25% import tariff for Canada and Mexico starting February 1, 2025, along with a 10% import tariff for China. However, Trump mentioned that they have not determined whether the import tariffs will also cover oil commodities. Trump stressed that the tariffs are aimed at addressing the large number of undocumented migrants and narcotics crossing the US border, as well as the trade deficit with neighboring countries. The price of gold in the spot market rose +1.4% to the level of 2,796 US dollars per troy ounce on Thursday (30/1), marking an all-time high. This rise in gold prices was triggered by safe haven demand due to geopolitical uncertainty and concerns about global economic growth amidst US President Donald Trump's planned import tariff threats.

marketNews.title: US Economic Data and Index Rebalancing
marketNews.content: The US recorded economic growth of +2.3% YoY in Q4 2024 (vs. Q3 2024: +3.1% YoY), based on initial estimates. This result was lower than the consensus expectation which predicted growth of +2.6% YoY. US economic growth in Q4 2024 was supported by consumer spending - the largest contributor to the US economy - which grew +4.2% YoY, marking the highest level since the end of Q4 21. During 2024, the US economy grew +2.8% YoY (vs. 2023: +2.9% YoY). The LQ45 and IDX30 indices officially rebalanced at the close of trading today (31/1) with an effective period of February 3 - April 30, 2025. This rebalancing was previously announced on Wednesday (22/1). Here are the details: LQ45: In: $CTRA, $JPFA, $MAPA; Out: $BUKA, $INTP, $MTEL. IDX30: In: $EXCL, $ISAT; Out: $ACES, $PGEO.

tickerNews.title: Hanwha Plans to Acquire 40% Stake in NOBU
tickerNews.content: $NOBU: Hanwha Life Insurance Co. Ltd. announced a plan to acquire approximately 3 billion (40%) shares of Bank Nationalnobu with an undisclosed total transaction value. The shares will be purchased from PT Putera Mulia Indonesia, PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa, and Multipolar ($MLPL).

tickerNews.title: Alam Sutera Realty Targets Marketing Sales of IDR 3.5 Trillion in 2025
tickerNews.content: $ASRI: Alam Sutera Realty targets marketing sales of 3.5 trillion rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2024 target: 2.8 trillion rupiah, 2024 realization: 3.16 trillion rupiah). ASRI estimates that 85% of the total 2025 marketing sales will come from the residential segment, while the remainder will come from the commercial segment. ASRI stated that in the next few years, the company will focus on launching clusters in Sutera Rasuna, Suvarna Sutera, and Sutera Nexen.

tickerNews.title: Indosat and Wadhwani Foundation Sign MOU for AI Training Program
tickerNews.content: $ISAT: Indosat and Wadhwani Foundation signed a memorandum of understanding for cooperation worth 3.5 trillion rupiah to provide artificial intelligence (AI) training for 1 million digital talents and 100,000 Indonesian entrepreneurs. The partnership will last for 3 years.

tickerNews.title: Sarana Menara Nusantara Secures Green Loan Facility from SMBC Indonesia ($BTPN)
tickerNews.content: $TOWR: Sarana Menara Nusantara through its business entity, PT Iforte Energi Nusantara, signed a green loan facility agreement and/or revolving credit facility with a total commitment value of 150 billion rupiah from SMBC Bank Indonesia ($BTPN). The facility will mature 3 months from the date of the final drawdowns of each facility.

tickerNews.title: VKTR Director Purchases 12.5 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $VKTR: VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Director, Achmad Amri Aswono Putro, purchased 12.5 million VKTR shares at an average price of 100 rupiah per share on January 23, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.25 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Achmad Amri Aswono Putro's ownership in VKTR increased from none previously to 0.07%.

tickerNews.title: AMOR to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: $AMOR: Ashmore Asset Management Indonesia plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 14 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiated markets is February 7, 2025, with payment on February 24, 2025. Referring to AMOR's share price at the close of trading on Friday (31/1) at 680 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 2.1%. This is the second interim dividend distribution for the 2024 fiscal year from AMOR, following the interim dividend of 27.5 rupiah per share in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: Hexindo Adiperkasa Reports Net Profit of USD 10.1 Million for 3Q24
tickerNews.content: $HEXA: Hexindo Adiperkasa recorded a net profit of US$10.1 million (+90.5% QoQ, -21.8% YoY) for 3Q24 ending December 31, 2024. This result brought HEXA's net profit for 9M24 to US$21.1 million (-51.8% YoY). The quarterly net profit increase in 3Q24 was primarily due to a +2% QoQ increase in revenue, and an increase in operating profit margin to 9.8% (vs 2Q24: 9.2%). Additionally, the net profit increase was supported by a +62% QoQ increase in other income due to a warranty claim income of US$1.1 million.
